trans-unit.source: Represents the binding element used to specify the queuing communication properties for a Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) service that uses the native Message Queuing (MSMQ) protocol.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement> enables the user to set the properties of the queued communication channel.
The queued communication channel uses Message Queuing for its transport.
This binding element is the default binding element used by the Message Queuing standard binding (<xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding>).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement"></xref> class.
Builds a channel factory using the context provided.
A channel factory is created and initialized using the properties that have been set in the binding element.
The initialized channel factory is then used to create output channels that can be used to send messages to a message queue.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> with which to build the channel factory.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IOutputSessionChannel"></xref> or a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IOutputChannel"></xref> class.
A Message Queuing (MSMQ) channel factory that can be used to create channels to send messages to existing Message Queuing applications.
The context value is null.
The TChannel is not IOutputChannel or IOutputSessionChannel.
MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel is EncryptAndSign and UseActiveDirectory is false.
Builds a channel listener using the context provided.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> with which to build the channel listener.
The channel type to be used to build the channel listener.
Permitted channel types are <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IInputSessionChannel"></xref> or a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IInputChannel"></xref> class.
A Message Queuing (MSMQ) channel listener that can be used to create channels to receive messages from existing MSMQ applications.
The context value is null.
The TChannel is not IInputChannel or IInputSessionChannel.
MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqAuthenticationMode is Certificate or WindowsDomain and MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel is None.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether you can build a channel factory with the context provided.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> with which to build the channel factory.
The channel type to be used to build the channel listener.
Permitted channel types are <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IOutputSessionChannel"></xref> or a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IOutputChannel"></xref> class.
`true` if you can build a channel factory with the context provided; otherwise, `false`.
The binding element returns `true` only when TChannel is or .
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether you can build a channel listener with the context provided.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> with which to build the channel listener.
The channel type to be used to build the channel listener.
Permitted channel types are <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IInputSessionChannel"></xref> or a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IInputChannel"></xref> class.
`true` if you can build a channel listener with the context provided; otherwise, `false`.
The binding returns `true` only when TChannel is or .
Returns a clone of the binding element.
A clone of the binding element.
Gets or sets an integer that specifies the maximum size of the pool that contains internal Message Queuing (MSMQ) message objects.
The internal Message Queuing message object pool is used to avoid allocations of these objects when sending and receiving messages.
The maximum pool size is a performance-tuning parameter.
The default value is 8.
An integer that specifies the maximum size of the pool that contains internal Message Queuing message objects.
The value is less than zero.
Gets or sets an enumeration value that indicates the queued communication channel transport that this binding uses.

Message Queuing (MSMQ) does not support Active Directory addressing when using SOAP Reliable Messaging Protocol (SRMP), so do not set <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement.QueueTransferProtocol%2A> to <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueueTransferProtocol.Srmp> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueueTransferProtocol.Srmp> when <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement.UseActiveDirectory%2A> is set to `true`.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.QueueTransferProtocol"></xref> enumeration value that indicates the transport used for message delivery between queue managers.
The value is not one of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.QueueTransferProtocol"></xref> values.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the addressing scheme that is used by this transport binding element.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement.Scheme%2A> property returns the string "net.msmq".
The Message Queuing (MSMQ) queued transport supports several addressing schemes, including net.msmq.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the addressing scheme that is used by this transport binding element.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory.
Message Queuing (MSMQ) queue addresses can consist of path names or direct format names.
With a direct format name, MSMQ resolves the queue name using DNS, NetBIOS, or IP.
With a path name, MSMQ resolves the queue name using Active Directory.
By default, the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] queued transport converts the URI of a message queue to a direct format name.

By setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqTransportBindingElement.UseActiveDirectory%2A> property to `true`, an application can specify that the queued transport should resolve the computer name using Active Directory rather than DNS, NetBIOS, or IP.
`true` if queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory; otherwise, `false`.
